snippet.title: Ski Champ (1998 SEGA)/Model 3
snippet.description:
Ski Champ is a skiing game developed Sega AM1 and published by Sega released for their own Model 3 hardware in 1998. It features a stand-up cabinet that simulates real skiing motions. It is a successor to Sega Ski Super G model 2 game.

The game has 4 routes with 2 different ending stages, for a total of five stages, as usual time record is the best way to climb the high score ladder.
Controlling the ski poles is crucial to keep high speed and do quick turns without losing it or avoiding  obstacles on the map,sometimes when you reach some heights the game ask you to charge a jump (holding both poles down) and do a trick with your feet pedals,reward for doing it properly is a super high speed,failing it will slow you down completely.

This very fun single player arcade game is also using Model 3 power at best, so it looks and sounds great,good luck and compete to be the very best.
